Introduction.Name: Hord of Chaos

Magic.Name: Lore of Nurgle
Magic.Alternative: Lore of Tzeentch, Slaanesh, Death, Fire, Shadow

Introduction.Annotation:
The Warriors of Chaos, also known as the Hordes of Chaos, the Followers of Chaos, Chaos Undivided, the Northern Barbarians or simply just the Northmen, are the names given to a race of savage, warlike tribes of Human Barbarians that occupy the harsh and unforgiving lands of the uppermost North, known in the lands of the Old World as the dreaded Northern Waste.

To all those that face them, the northern barbarians are considered by all to be the enemies of all the world, whose unwavering worship to an uncaring and sadistic pantheon of ancient and evil gods has given them a single driving motive to usher in the inevitable downfall of all mortal-kind into their hellish enslavement.

Out of all the many threats that the Old World must face, none strikes such fear and misery into the hearts of Men like the Followers of Chaos. Slaves to darkness all, they have given themselves wholly to the Ruinous Powers, some willingly, others because they felt they had no other choice.
Introduction.Authors: Gav Thorpe, Rick Priestly, Anthony Reynolds and Alessio Cavatore

Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strenght

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 Armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ Armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ ward save

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.Rule: +1 to dispell
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispell

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: Chaos Daemon Sword
Artefact.Rule: The wielder has WS, S, I and A as the Greater Daemon of their patron god. With a Mark of Chaos only (except the Mark of Chaos Undivided)
Artefact.Description: A character with a Daemon Sword has the same WS, S, I and A as the Greater Daemon of their patron god (eg, a Champion of Khorne would have Weapon Skill 10, Strength 7, Initiative 10 and Attacks 7). However, every roll of a 1 to hit in close combat means that the attack is resolved against the character instead of the enemy. Furthermore, the character can never re-roll an unmodified 1 to hit in close combat, regardless of the source of the re-roll.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Change
Artefact.Rule: Roll a D6 every time an enemy character or monster is slain by the Sword of Change. On a 4+ the model is turned into a Chaos Spawn (with only D3 Wounds) controlled by the Chaos player
Artefact.Description: Roll a D6 every time an enemy character or monster is slain by the Sword of Change. On a roll of 1, 2 or 3 nothing happens. On a roll of 4 or more, the model is turned into a Chaos Spawn controlled by the Chaos player! Replace the model with a Chaos Spawn model. If you do not have a spare Chaos Spawn model the model is slain, but the sword has no additional effect. If the enemy is in a unit, dien the Spawn model is placed in contact with the unit on one of its free sides (bearer's choice) and will fight as normal in subsequent combat rounds. The Chaos Spawn starts with only D3 Wounds.

Artefact.Name: Hellfire sword
Artefact.Rule: flaming
Artefact.Description: Flaming attacks, D6 additional wounds with no armour saves

Artefact.Name: Chaos Runesword
Artefact.Description: The wielder gains +1 Weapon Skill, +1 Strength and +1 Attack.

Artefact.Name: Whip of Pleasure
Artefact.Description: The wielder gains + 1 Attack, but he cannot carry a shield or banner. In addition, the wielder always strikes first in close combat. If any of the wielder's opponents also always strike first, revert to normal Initiative.

Artefact.Name: Berserker sword
Artefact.Rule: Half the Unit Strength of all enemy models in base contact as additional Attacks
Artefact.Description: The wielder of the Berserker Sword may make additional attacks in every Close Combat phase. The number of additional attacks is equal to half the Unit Strength of all enemy models in base contact (rounding up). For example, a character in contact with two Ogres (combined Unit Strength of 6) would get 3 additional Attacks. If the bearer is involved in a challenge, only the Unit Strength of the opponent is counted.

Artefact.Name: Rending sword
Artefact.Rule: Wounded model loses not one but D3 wounds
Artefact.Description: A model wounded by the Rending Sword (after saves, etc) loses not one but D3 wounds.

Artefact.Name: Blade of Blood
Artefact.Rule: For each unsaved wound which the Blade of Blood causes, the wielder gains +1 Wound by Strength test
Artefact.Description: For each unsaved wound which the Blade of Blood causes, the wielder may take a Strength test. If the test is passed, the wielder gains +1 Wound. This may not increase his Wounds value above double its normal number of Wounds. If the test is tailed, the wielder loses one Wound.

Artefact.Name: Filth Mace
Artefact.Description: All attacks with the Filth Mace count as poisoned attacks. In addition, if the bearer of the mace kills an enemy character in close combat, he will cause terror for the rest of the game.

Artefact.Name: Soul Cleaver
Artefact.Description: Any model wounded by the Soul Cleaver (after saves, etc) must pass a Toughness test or suffer an additional wound (with no saves allowed).

Artefact.Name: Axe of Khorn
Artefact.Description: Confers on the bearer the Killing Blow ability.

Artefact.Name: Spelleater Shield
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (2)
Roll a D6 each time a spell is dispelled. On a roll of 4+ the spell is destroyed and the enemy Wizard may not cast it for the rest of the battle.
Artefact.Description: The Spelleater Shield is treated like a normal shield. In addition, it grants Magic Resistance (2) to the character and any unit he is with. Roll a D6 each time a spell is cast at the bearer of the Spelleater Shield and is dispelled. On a roll of 4 or more, the spell is destroyed and the enemy Wizard mav not cast it for the rest of the battle.

Artefact.Name: Chaos Runeshield
Artefact.Rule: Runeshiel negates the power of any magic weapons carried by models in base contac.
Artefact.Description: The Chaos Runeshield is treated like a normal shield. It also negates the power of any magic weapons carried by models in base contact - treat them as ordinary non-magical weapons of their type.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Tortured Souls
Artefact.Description: The Armour of Tortured Souls is a suit of Chaos armour. The wearer counts as having +1 Toughness against mundane attacks (not against spells, magic items, etc).

Artefact.Name: Armour of Damnation
Artefact.Description: The Armour of Damnation is a suit of Chaos armour. In addition, any model attacking the wearer in close combat must re-roll successful rolls to hit.

Artefact.Name: Bone Shield
Artefact.Rule: Strength 4 hit for each successful armour save
Artefact.Description: The Bane Shield is treated like a normal shield. In addition, for each successful armour save in close combat, the shield inflicts a Strength 4 hit on the model that struck the blow.

Artefact.Name: Crimson Armour of Dargan
Artefact.Description: The Crimson Armour is a suit of Chaos armour. In addition, any model wishing to attack the wearer in close combat must first pass a Leadership test or they may not attack that combat round.

Artefact.Name: The Beguiling Gem
Artefact.Description: All enemy models in base contact with the bearer of the Beguiling Gem must take a Leadership test at the start of every Close Combat phase. Any model which fails is transfixed and may not make any attacks that round, and any attacks made against it by the bearer will hit automatically.

Artefact.Name: Amulet of Chaos
Artefact.Description: At the start of every Chaos Magic phase, any enemy models in contact with the wearer must pass a Strength test or lose one wound, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: GoldenEye of Tzeentch
Artefact.Rule: Ward save of 3+ against all normal and magical missiles
Artefact.Description: The model and his mount have a Ward save of 3+ against all normal and magical missiles.

Artefact.Name: Gaze of the Gods
Artefact.Rule: If the model is fleeing at the start of a Chaos Magic phase he is turned into a Chaos Spawn
Artefact.Description: The model gains a 4+ Ward save. If the model is fleeing at the start of a Chaos Magic phase, for any reason, the wrath of the Chaos gods is immediately visited upon him and he is turned into a Chaos Spawn, with the same number of wounds remaining as the character had. If you do not have a Spawn model to replace the character then he simply counts as slain. For Victory points purposes, the character is not counted as slain or below half Wounds unless the Spawn he has turned into is slain or is below half Wounds.

Artefact.Name: Collar of Khorne
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (2)
Artefact.Description: The model has Magic Resistance (2).

Artefact.Name: Staff of Change
Artefact.Rule: The bearer can re-roll any number of the dice rolled to cast or dispel
Artefact.Description: The bearer can re-roll any number of the dice rolled to cast or dispel a spell The second result(s) stand. This can effectively negate the effects of a Miscast and cause an Irresistible Force (and the equivalent results when dispelling). If the bearer casts a spell with Irresistible Force using the staff's re-roll ability, the staff will exhaust its power and cease working for the rest of the battle.

Artefact.Name: Skull of Katam
Artefact.Rule: The bearer adds +1 to all Casting rolls
Artefact.Description: The bearer adds +1 to all Casting rolls.

Artefact.Name: Power Familiar
Artefact.Description: The Familiar adds one dice to both the Power dice and Dispel dice pool of the bearer's side.

Artefact.Name: Warrior Familiar
Artefact.Rule: Strength 5 hit on a single model in base contact
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the Close Combat phase, before blows are struck, the Familiar inflicts one Strength 5 hit on a single model chosen by the Sorcerer from amongst those in base contact. Wounds inflicted do count towards combat resolution.

Artefact.Name: Spell Familiar
Artefact.Rule: One more spell
Artefact.Description: The Familiar's owner knows one more spell than is normal for his level. This does not increase his Magic Level.

Artefact.Name: Rod of Corruption
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell. Power Level 4. One use only. D6 Strength 2 hits at the start of the Magic phase, 2D6 Strength 2 next Magic phase, etc
Artefact.Description: Bound spell. Power Level 4. One use only. Target any enemy unit on the tabletop. This unit becomes infected with Nurgle's Rot and suffers D6 Strength 2 hits, distributed as shooting hits amongst the models in the unit. At the start of the caster's next Magic phase, the unit takes 2D6 Strength 2 hits. At the start of the caster's Magic phase after that it takes 3D6 Strength 2 hits, and so on. Once cast, Nurgle's Rot cannot be stopped.

Artefact.Name: Bindings of Slaanesh
Artefact.Rule: Enemy cannot refuse challenge
Artefact.Description: Whenever the bearer issues a challenge, the enemy cannot refuse it and the Chaos player may choose who will accept the challenge. The model forced to accept the challenge may be anywhere within the enemy unit, and even characters that would normally be in a position that would disallow them from accepting challenges (by not being in the fighting rank, for instance) may be forced into accepting the challenge. In the first round an enemy is ensnared, the bearer always strike last, regardless of any other factor, magic item or spell.

Artefact.Name: Book of Secrets
Artefact.Description: The bearer is a Level 1 Sorcerer and knows a random spell from the Lore of Fire, Shadow or Death (Chaos player's choice). If the bearer miscasts, roll twice on the Miscast table and apply both results.

Artefact.Name: Chalice of Chaos
Artefact.Rule: Daemonic
Artefact.Description: The bearer becomes daemonic and follows all of the rules outlined in the Bestiary section. If the bearer is the army's General, he must lead a daemonic army. Remember, a daemonic character cannot join non-daemonic units. At the start of the battle he must take a Toughness test (remember that rolls of 6 always fail). If the test is failed, the bearer reduces his Wounds and Toughness by -1.

Artefact.Name: Death's Head
Artefact.Rule: One use only. D6 hits with D3 wounds with no armour by Toughness test for a range of 12"
Artefact.Description: One use only. The model may throw the Death's Head in the Shooting phase. It is treated as a thrown weapon with a range of 12". If the Death's Head hits, the enemy unit takes D6 hits, and affected models must pass a Toughness test or lose D3 wounds, with no armour saves allowed. Units taking any casualties from a Death's Head must take a Panic test.

Artefact.Name: Sceptre of Domination
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell Delectable Torture. Power Level 6. One use only.
Artefact.Description: Bound spell. Power Level 6. One use only. The Sceptre of Domination contains the bound Slaanesh spell Delectable Torture.

Artefact.Name: Helm of Many Eyes
Artefact.Description: The wearer always strikes first in close combat, even if charged or armed with a weapon that normally strikes last. If any of the wearer's opponents also strike first, revert to normal Initiative. The character is also subject to stupidity (even if immune to psychology) due to the random and conflicting images that confront him.

Artefact.Name: Mirror of Knowledge
Artefact.Rule: Opponent must reveal everything that is not apparent about the unit
Artefact.Description: The bearer can pick any enemy unit on the battlefield at the beginning of each of his Magic phases. The opponent must reveal everything that is not apparent about the unit (magic items and their bearers, hidden Assassins and Fanatics, etc).

Artefact.Name: Banner of the Gods
Artefact.Rule: All non-daemonic friendly units within 6" of the banner become stubborn
Artefact.Description: All non-daemonic friendly units within 6" of the banner become stubborn (even if normally immune to psychology).

Artefact.Name: Banner of Rage
Artefact.Rule: Model and unit may re-roll failed Break tests and will not lose their frenzy
Artefact.Description: The model and any unit he is with may re-roll failed Break tests and will not lose their frenzy if beaten in close combat.

Artefact.Name: Plague Banner
Artefact.Description: Any enemy model in contact with the banner bearer at the start of the Chaos Magic phase must pass a Toughness test or suffer a wound Armour saves are not allowed. This banner has no effect on models with the Mark of Nurgle or Clan Pestilens Skaven

Artefact.Name: Blasted Standard
Artefact.Rule: The banner contains the bound Tzeentch spell Yellow Fire of Transformation
Artefact.Description: The banner contains the bound Tzeentch spell Yellow Fire of Transformation.

Artefact.Name: Banner of Wrath
Artefact.Rule: Bound spell. Power Level 4. The banner contains a bound magic missile with range 24", causing D6 Strength 4 hits
Artefact.Description: Bound spell. Power Level 4. The banner contains a bound magic missile with range 24", causing D6 Strength 4 hits.

Artefact.Name: Rapturous Standard
Artefact.Rule: The model and any unit he is with count as having the Daemonic Gift - Soporific Musk
Artefact.Description: The model and any unit he is with count as having the Daemonic Gift - Soporific Musk.

Artefact.Name: Chaos Disruption
Artefact.Rule: Any shooting at the Daemon or the unit it is with suffers an additional -1 to hit penalty
Artefact.Description: Any shooting at the Daemon or the unit it is with suffers an additional -1 to hit penalty.

Artefact.Name: Blade of The Ether
Artefact.Description: Daemon ignore armour saves in close combat

Artefact.Name: Radiance of Dark Glory
Artefact.Rule: The Daemon and any other Daemon unit within 6" suffers one less wound when defeated in combat
Artefact.Description: The Daemon and any other Daemon unit within 6" suffers one less wound when defeated in combat. For example, if the Daemon fails its Instability test by 2, flien it would only lose one wound.

Artefact.Name: Soul Hunger
Artefact.Rule: The Daemon may re-roll missed close combat attacks in the first round of any combat
Artefact.Description: The Daemon may re-roll missed close combat attacks in the first round of any combat.

Artefact.Name: Spell Breaker
Artefact.Rule: Once per battle, the Daemon may automatically dispel one enemy spell, except one which has just been cast with Irresistible Force
Artefact.Description: Once per battle, the Daemon may automatically dispel one enemy spell, except one which has just been cast with Irresistible Force.

Artefact.Name: Diabolic Splendour
Artefact.Rule: Daemonic Aura becomes a normal Ward save and so can be used against magical attacks
Artefact.Description: Daemonic Aura becomes a normal Ward save and so can be used against magical attacks. This is also conferred to any Daemon unit which he joins.

Artefact.Name: Master of Mortals
Artefact.Description: If the Daemon is the army General, Mortal units count as Core choices and Daemonic units count as Special.

Artefact.Name: Collar of Khorne
Artefact.Rule: Magic Resistance (2)
Artefact.Description: The model has Magic Resistance (2).

Artefact.Name: Axe of Khorne
Artefact.Description: Daemon with an Axe gains the Killing Blow ability

Artefact.Name: Armour of Khorne
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has an armour save of 4+ in addition to its Daemonic aura.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Khorne
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has +1 Strength on its profile.

Artefact.Name: Tzeentch's Will
Artefact.Rule: The Daemon may re-roll a single D6 once per turn
Artefact.Description: The Daemon may re-roll a single D6 once per turn. The re-roll endtles the player to take a single D6 (including one of the dice rolled as part of a 2D6, 3D6, etc) and roll it again. Any D6 can be re-rolled and can potentially cause Irresistible-Force or avoid a Miscast. Remember that you cannot re-roll a dice more than once.

Artefact.Name: Spell Destroyer
Artefact.Rule: May automatically dispel one enemy spell per battle, except if cast with Irresistible Force. In addition roll a D6. On a 4+ enemy Wizard loses knowledge of the spell
Artefact.Description: Once per battle the Daemon may automatically dispel one enemy spell, except one which has just been cast with Irresistible Force. In addition, roll a D6. On a roll of 4+, the enemy Wizard loses knowledge of that spell and may not cast it for the rest of the battle.

Artefact.Name: Master of Sorcery
Artefact.Rule: The Daemon has great magical knowledge and knows one more spell from the Lore of Tzeentch than it is normally allowed
Artefact.Description: The Daemon has great magical knowledge and knows one more spell from the Lore of Tzeentch than it is normally allowed.

Artefact.Name: Power Vortex
Artefact.Rule: Daemon may give up Wounds to generate D3 Power dice
Artefact.Description: At any point during the Chaos Magic phase, the Daemon may give up Wounds to generate Power dice (with no saves of any kind allowed, no Ward saves, no regeneration, etc). For each Wound sacrificed, the Daemon generates an extra D3 Power dice, that turn which only it may use.

Artefact.Name: Cloud of Flies
Artefact.Description: Any unit in close combat with one or more models with a Cloud of Flies suffers a -1 modifier on its rolls to hit.

Artefact.Name: Stream of Corruption
Artefact.Rule: Breath attack with Strength 3, with a -2 armour saving
Artefact.Description: The Daemon spews forth a noxious stream of disease and filth. In any of the Chaos player's Shooting phases that the Daemon is not in combat, it may unleash its Stream of Corruption. This is a breath attack. The attack is resolved at Strength 3, with a -2 armour saving throw modifier.

Artefact.Name: Stream of Corruption
Artefact.Description: The Daemon's attacks count as poisoned attacks. This gift cannot be combined with a Blade of the Ether gift.

Artefact.Name: Aura of Slaanesh
Artefact.Rule: Enemy unit in base contact reduces Ld by -1 to minimum Ld value of 2
Artefact.Description: Any enemy unit in base contact with one or more models with the Aura of Slaanesh reduces its Leadership by -1, to a minimum Leadership value of 2.

Artefact.Name: Soporific Musk
Artefact.Rule: Any model in base contact halve WS and Initiative (rounding up)
Artefact.Description: Any models in base contact with one or more Daemons with Soporific Musk halve their WS and 1 (rounding up).

Artefact.Name: Gaze of Acquiescence
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the Close Combat phase, select one model in base contact with the Daemon. The target must pass a Leadership test or may not make any attacks in that Close Combat phase. Models immune to psychology cannot be affected.

Hero.Name: Archaon, Lord of the End Times
Hero.Description: Archaon, Lord of the End Times

Special.Rule: Archaon's army must include at least one unit of Knights of Chaos, and they must be upgraded to Chosen status

Hero.Name: Galrauch, First of the Chaos Dragons
Hero.Description: Galrauch, First of the Chaos Dragons

Special.Rule: May automatically dispel one enemy spell per battle, except if cast with Irresistible Force. In addition roll a D6. On a 4+ enemy Wizard loses knowledge of the spell
May re-roll a single D6 once per turn
Knows one more spell from the Lore of Tzeentch than it is normally allowed
Ward save cannot be used against magical attacks
Enemy unit in base contact reduces Ld by -1 to minimum Ld value of 2
Any model in base contact halve WS and Initiative (rounding up)
May re-roll one dice per turn except one that has already been re-rolled
May automatically dispel one enemy spell per battle, except if cast with Irresistible Force. In addition roll a D6. On a 4+ enemy Wizard loses knowledge of the spell
Knows one more lore of Tzeentch spell than normally allowed
In Chaos player's Shooting phase if Daemon is not in combat it may unleash Stream of Corruption - Breath attack, Strength 3 with -2 armour saving throw modifier
Breath attack Strength 3 with a -2 armour modifier
